paper_abstract: In this paper we present ongoing work on how to incorporate human motion models into the design of a high performance teleoperation platform. A short description of human motion models used for ball-catching is followed by a more detailed study of a teleoperation platform on which to conduct experiments. Also, a pilot study using minimum jerk theory to explain user input behavior in teleoperated catching is presented. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Teleoperation for a ball-catching task with significant dynamics
